meanings.definition: The lower jaw or mandible of a person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The underjaws help in chewing food.
meanings.sent2: The dentist examined the underjaws of the dog.
meanings.sent3: The underjaws of the lion looked strong and powerful.
meanings.sent5: The underjaws of the shark snapped shut with a loud click.

meanings.definition: To grip or hold something with the lower jaw or mandible.
meanings.sent1: The puppy tried to underjaws the bone but it slipped away.
meanings.sent2: The crocodile underjawsed the prey firmly in its mouth.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel underjawsed the nut playfully before burying it.
meanings.sent4: His underjawsing of the pen showed his frustration.
meanings.sent5: She underjawsed the rope tightly to secure the boat.
